title: How would people use a mobile app for event planning? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are planning a conference, exhibition, trade show, workshop, or a corporate event, then using an event app can help you plan, organize and manage all the details of your event in one place. Eventtus’ event app features are designed to make it efficient and easier for the organizer to plan and execute a successful event. The event app focuses on the important values of an event: Networking and connecting relevant people togetherthrough features like private messaging, meeting scheduler, smart matchmaking Informing and keeping everyone up-to-datethrough push notifications, an interactive 3D venue map, social feed in a private social network, updated & personalized agenda Interacting and engaging with the attendeesthrough live Q&As, live polls & surveys, sessions & talks rating Developing long-term partnerships with the significant stakeholdersthrough promoting your app sponsors, featuring the exhibiting sponsors and advertising the event partners Performance analysisthrough reports, data, analytics, statistics..all on your event's own dashboard.  If you want to learn more about how an event app can help you plan and manage for your events, you can contact me and the sales team to arrange a meeting together, or you can request a free demonstration of our solutions at Eventtus.

I'll chime in since some of these answers are massively outdated.  The event planning industry has seen significant growth the past 5 years.  Just this past year 86% of event planners are expected to have an app at their event which shows that mobile apps are essential at this point.    Some useful features  Create event registration formsCreate event invitationsExport guest data to create name tags/scan barcodesCollect payments Manage vendor registration Data collection, stats and analytics are all very important to anyone looking to stay in the event planning business.  How can you improve if you don't know the hard numbers?  If you are going to plan an event and not keep up with past attendees, either for feedback (Surveys, comments) or for future promotion you established that  event planning isn't for you.  The ability to collect emails to keep past attendees in the loop for your future events is worth it's weight in gold.   Using a mobile event planning app along with solid event planning skills will make any function go smoothly.
